column5: I was driving back to Waterloo last evening after a so-so day of kayak fishing Arran Lake.  Feeling that my bass itch hadn't quite been scratched, I decided to make a pit stop in my hometown where I spent many late evenings as a kid fishing topwater.  After a few huge Rocky's, small smallies and a small battle with two beavers to hold my position, I was rewarded.    Not the fattest I've ever caught, but 22" and what an explosion of aerials this fish put up!  The card in my left hand is my OFC Team#8 Bernie's Bandits, but never showed on the flash.  Richard Elliott Jr., probably has it beat anyway.
That is a Beauty!!!!!  Congrats Nomad...what a way to end a day!!!!!
Nice smallie, that would have been fun in the kayak. How did you do on Aaran? We caught a nice smallie there a couple of years ago.
Nice bronze back nomad Jitterbug is my favorite lure for night time bassin... it sure is a blast seeing them hit it on surface  Great job and thanks for sharing Leechman
Of course we'll take your word for it. Anyone from team 8 is an upstanding individual who's integrity is beyond reproach. Jim
nice bass for sure AND it wasn't a jitterbug as those things are garbage  so it must have been a buzzbait....
nice fish... did u get to go for a "sleigh ride" with it too?
